titleStmt.title: William A. Nichols, Special Orders, No. 96
CWG12504

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: Union Artillery, Navy and Marines Primary Source Documents ; Misc U.S.C.T. Primary Source Documents
msIdentifier.idno: Box 14, Folder BTRY B, 2nd Battery, 1st REGT LIGHT ARTILLERY MISCELLANEOUS

body.p:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, February 29th, 1864.
SPECIAL ORDERS,
No. 96.

(Extract.)
45. Under the peculiar circumstances of the case, Private John W. Walls, 2d Kentucky Battery, is hereby honorably discharged the service of the United States.
By order of the Secretary of War:
W. A. NICHOLS,
Assistant Adjutant General.

OFFICIAL:
Saml Preck
Assistant Adjutant General.

War Department
Adjutant Genl Office
Feby 29. 1864
Nichols W. A.
A. A. G.
Spe. Ord. No 96 under peculiar circumstances of the case private John W. Walls 2nd Ky Batty is honorably discharged.
Recd at A. G. O. Mar 5. 1864
